Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[layout binding] Layout binding usage crashes on startup" (#1659) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Build and run the attached project on device or emulator:

[App24.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/files/1985216/App24.zip)


<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

### Expected Behavior
Layout binding API usage compiles and runs.

### Actual Behavior
Attempting to access layout widgets via layout binding results in a crash.

### Version Information
VS 15.7
xamarin-android/master/5d8c2183
<!--
1. On macOS and within Visual Studio, select Visual Studio > About Visual Studio, then click the Show Details button, then click the Copy Information button.

2. Paste below this comment block.
-->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Add new facades" (#1658) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
System.Resources.Reader.dll and System.Resources.Writer.dll were added to Mono 2018-02.
System.Drawing.Common.dll was added to Mono 2017-12.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[mono-runtime] Remap Mono.Cecil for utilities" (#1654) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/issues/1652

Xamarin.Android doesn't ship `Mono.Cecil.dll`, as it is not fully
API-stable, and there have been historical problems when multiple
different versions of `Mono.Cecil.dll` were being used within the same
process at the same time.

Our solution to this was to "vendorize" `Mono.Cecil` into
`Xamarin.Android.Cecil.dll`, and update any utilities which reference
`Mono.Cecil.dll` to instead reference `Xamarin.Android.Cecil.dll` by
using `remap-assembly-ref.exe`; see also e814528c.

Unfortunately we overlooked some utilities.

Update `mono-runtimes.targets` so that `illinkanalyzer.exe`,
`mono-symbolicate.exe`, and `mkbundle.exe` have any assembly
references to `Mono.Cecil` remap'd to target `Xamarin.Android.Cecil`.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Links against ABI-unstable system Mono.Cecil" (#1652) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Mono.Cecil is a very unstable library (which has hurt us in the past). It's dangerous to trust the version in the GAC will ever be the same between minor Mono point releases

Currently, the linking for `$PREFIX/xamarin.android/xbuild/Xamarin/Android/illinkanalyzer.exe` uses the GAC version of Mono.Cecil, which should be avoided where possible (e.g. if XA was built with Mono 5.10, but runs on 5.12, who knows how many symbols won't even be there any more in Cecil?)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] Designer items should be const for apps." (#1657) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
The `ManagedResourceParser` was not taking into account the fact
that the app should be using `const` not `static` for the
resource fields.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "Bump to mono/2018-04" (#1656) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Opened pull request "Bump to mono/2018-04" (#1656) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Opened pull request "[CodeBehind] Generate codebehind source in design time build" (#1655) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
IDEs don't build the project until the user tells them to (either to debug or
just build) and thus initially the codebehind sources are not generated. This
causes the lack of intellisense as well as error reports from the IDE about
missing types etc. However, IDE uses a so-called "design-time build" to update
project resources and generate source files related to this task. Layout
codebehind generation should be done at the same time and this patch is an
attempt to make it so by adding the `_IncludeLayoutBindingSources` target
dependency to the `_ManagedUpdateAndroidResgen` target used by
design-time-build.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Basic examples for usage with PowerShell Core" (#2640) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi there,

could you provide a few simple examples that show how to use it with PowerShell Core?
That would open also cross platform GUIs for sysadmins like me :bowing_man: 

Thanks in advance

Ruben

PS: An example traditional [windows.forms](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/scripting/getting-started/cookbooks/creating-a-custom-input-box?view=powershell-6) with PowerShell.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Enhancement] Report Binding failures" (#2639) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
# Rationale

In Xamarin.Forms, when a {Binding} expression fails, it fails silently, and at runtime. The only indication that the binding has failed is that nothing appears in the UI. Debugging this can be difficult--is it a BindingContext issue? A typo in my property name? Did I accidentally define my property as a member variable? Etc.

# Suggestion

Log binding failures similarly to the way that WPF and UWP do:

>System.Windows.Data Error: 40 : BindingExpression path error: 'NonExistingProperty' property not found on 'object' ''Grid' (Name='pnlMain')'. BindingExpression:Path=NonExistingProperty; DataItem='Grid' (Name='pnlMain'); target element is 'TextBlock' (Name=''); target property is 'Text' (type 'String') 

and print them out to the Debug log.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Pull to refresh doesn't work if iOS 11 large titles is enabled" (#1905) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
Pull to refresh doesn't work if iOS 11 large titles is enabled. If I disable large titles it works.

### Steps to Reproduce

Implement large titles like in my blog post, http://danielhindrikes.se/xamarin/ios-11-large-titles-in-xamarin-forms-apps/

### Expected Behavior
Listview to refresh

### Actual Behavior
Nothing happens

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 2.5.0.280555
- IDE: Visual Studio for mac 7.3.3
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - iOS:  11.2
  
- Affected Devices: iPhone simulator

### Screenshots

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "Add a way to set RaiseOnEqual flag in bindable property to true" (#1950) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

Bindable properties are not set when the original value reference equals the new value. Xamarin.Forms includes an internal flag `SetValueFlags.RaiseOnEqual` to change this behavior. While this flag is correctly checked when applying a new value, there is no way to enable this flag.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a bindable property
2. Set the value of the property
3. Explicitly set the same value again

### Expected Behavior

Property changed notification and a way to enable this behavior (as an option in the Bindable Property)

### Actual Behavior

No notification

### Use case

The bindable property contains information with a metric unit (e.g. 1 meter). The information is stored in an abstract way without a unit and the unit itself is added with an `IValueConverter`.

The user of the app changes his preferences; he now wants to see all information in imperial units. The source triggers a property changed notification with an empty string because all the converters need to be triggered again so that they can now represent the same information in a different manner (in this case: 3.28 feet).

### Relevant code

https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/blob/bfd3ad6491329e58ab145d20d2057ecfb0e06b52/Xamarin.Forms.Core/BindableObject.cs#L585

On line 585, there is a reference equals check. On lines 586 and 594 the code uses that check _or the unused RaiseOnEqual flag_ to verify if it should actually set the new value of the property.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 2.5.0.122203
- Last known good version: ???
- IDE: Visual Studio for Mac 7.3.3 (build 17)
- Platform Target Frameworks: all
- Android Support Library Version: N/A
- Affected Devices: all

### Screenshots

N/A

### Reproduction Link

Will provide if needed (since every app will show this behavior).

### IDE info

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[UWP] Fix crashes animation in the thread pool" (#2526) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

Check `HasThreadAccess` instead checking `LockApplicationHost` on `IsInvokeRequired`

### Bugs Fixed ###

Fixes #2327

### API Changes ###

None

### Behavioral Changes ###

`IsInvokeRequired` return true if `_dispatcher.HasThreadAccess` is false

### PR Checklist ###

- [ ] Has tests (if omitted, state reason in description)
- [x] Rebased on top of master at time of PR
- [ ] Changes adhere to coding standard
- [ ] Consolidate commits as makes sense

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "(Android)HorizontalTextAlignment not working in Entry Xamarin.Forms 3.0" (#2638) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
After upgrade to Xamarin.Forms 3.0, Entry's horizontal text alignment is always set to Start no matter what value i put for HorizontalTextAlignment.

Note: I assume its because of the [All] Basic Right-To-Left Support #1222  that cause the problem
+			if ((int)Build.VERSION.SdkInt > 16)
+			{
+				_mainText.TextAlignment = global::Android.Views.TextAlignment.ViewStart;
+				_detailText.TextAlignment = global::Android.Views.TextAlignment.ViewStart;
+			}

### Steps to Reproduce

1.  Create a new project
2.  Make an Entry and set horizontal text alignment to Center/End.

### Expected Behavior
Text in Entry is set to Center/End 

### Actual Behavior
Text in Entry is still set to Start

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.0.0.446417
- Last known good version: 2.5.1.527436
- IDE: Visual Studio 2017
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - iOS:  No issue
  - Android: Android 6.0 API 23


### Screenshots
![capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18006944/39784132-78c04754-536b-11e8-8614-432e41647e0a.PNG)
![xamlcode](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18006944/39784186-ad8e9f1c-536b-11e8-91cb-2a0c5e24443a.PNG)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Storyboard can't be opened in VS Community on MAC" (#4053) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
<--
I've an issue when open a storyboards in my test projects after i update Xamarin.iOS to Version: 11.10.1.177.

When i use another computer which installed just the previous version, the storyboards open just fine. So i think this is an issue in the new update.
-->
### Steps to Reproduce
Open a storyboards In VS Community

### Expected Behavior
Storyboard is loaded fine

### Actual Behavior
The storyboard can't open with this stack trace:

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[mmp]: Reflect latest 'FtpRequestCreator' -> 'FtpWebRequestCreator' change." (#4052) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Merged pull request "[mtouch] Take into account the contents of response files when determining whether the cache is valid or not. Fixes #4033. (#4032)" (#4051) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
* [mtouch] Take into account the contents of response files when determining whether the cache is valid or not.

* Correctly ignore new test on macOS.

Fixes #4033.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[mtouch] Take into account the contents of response files when determining whether the cache is valid or not. Fixes #4033. (#4032)" (#4051) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
* [mtouch] Take into account the contents of response files when determining whether the cache is valid or not.

* Correctly ignore new test on macOS.
